title: Python for Data Science (STEMTRIBE Africa)
description: A gentle but rigorous introduction to Python for data science and life-science applications. Covers syntax, data types, common libraries, basic machine learning, and a capstone project.

topics.title: Welcome to STEMTRIBE AFRICA
topics.intro: Welcome note and what to expect (A video by the instructor).
topics.description: Welcome to the world of Python. This module explains course goals, the provided virtual environment, and how Python underpins scientific computing, data science, machine learning, and bioinformatics. It orients learners to the course flow and expectations.

topics.title: Python Syntax Overview
topics.intro: Python is designed for readability with clean, intuitive syntax.
topics.description: Key syntax rules: indentation defines blocks; statements run top-to-bottom; Python is case-sensitive; strings use single or double quotes; use parentheses to call functions. Example: print("Hello, World!").

practiceQuestions.question: Which symbol defines indentation-based blocks in Python?

topics.title: Python Comments
topics.intro: Comments document code and explain analytical steps.
topics.description: Use # for single-line comments. Multi-line explanatory notes can use triple-quoted strings. Comments are essential for reproducible scientific code and collaboration.

topics.title: Python Variables
topics.intro: Variables store data values (numbers, strings, etc.).
topics.description: Assign values with =. Variables are dynamically typed and Python is case-sensitive. Use type() to inspect types.

topics.title: Core Data Types
topics.description: Discuss integers, floats, strings, booleans, and the None value. Show conversions and operations commonly used in data analysis.

topics.title: Lists, Tuples, Dictionaries, Sets
topics.intro: Common container types for structured data
topics.description: Explain when to use each structure and show basic operations (indexing, slicing, iteration, dict lookups).

topics.title: NumPy, pandas, Matplotlib
topics.intro: Essential libraries for numerical computing, tabular data, and visualization.
topics.description: Introduce array programming (NumPy), dataframes (pandas), and basic plotting (Matplotlib). Provide simple examples and links to further readings.

topics.title: Intro to ML Concepts
topics.intro: Supervised vs unsupervised learning, model evaluation
topics.description: Cover basic ML pipeline: data, features, models (e.g., linear regression, classification), training and evaluation, cross-validation.

topics.title: Capstone
topics.intro: Apply learned skills to a small data-science project relevant to life sciences.
topics.description: Students will pick a dataset, perform analysis, build simple models, and present findings. Instructor guidance on reproducible notebooks and reporting.
